frqParts.text: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The diagram below illustrates the electricity generation in ten countries during 2011. Country Population, 2001 (in millions) China 1,345.9 India 1,241.3 United States 311.7 Brazil 196.7 Russia 142.8 Japan 128.1 Germany 81.9 France 63.3 South Korea 49.0 Canada 34.5 (a) Based on the data in the graph, identify the fuel source that made the smallest contribution to total electricity generated in 2011 by the ten countries.
(b) Based on the data in the graph, identify the country that produced the highest percentage of its electricity in 2011 from hydroelectric sources.
(c) Based on the data in the graph, describe one environmental problem in Canada that could result if its total electricity generation was increased by 10 percent with its most-used fuel source.

(d) Based on the data in the graph, propose a solution to reduce an environmental problem linked to the primary fuel source used to generate electricity in France, other than reduced use of the fuel source.

(e) The ecological footprint of an average individual living in Germany is two times larger than the ecological footprint of an average individual living in China. Using the data provided in both the graph and table, make a claim that supports or refutes the hypothesis that the ecological footprint of Germany is larger than that of China.

(f) A conservationist group proposes a countywide program to distribute used commercial food storage containers to homeowners for use as rainwater barrels. They argue this action will reduce the ecological footprint of the county. Make a claim that supports or refutes the proposed rain barrel program to reduce the ecological footprint of the county.

Transportation is another major contributor to an individualâ€™s ecological footprint. In countries like the United States, passenger vehicles contribute to a range of environmental problems.(g) Describe one regulatory practice that could reduce the effect of passenger vehicles on sulfur dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere.
(h) Describe an additional benefit, other than reducing the air pollutant mentioned, that could result from the regulatory practice identified in part (g).
